result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John M. Garrett Jr.

records.addlTxt: Return date on December 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

No contact w/the victim, her mother and DE's aunt or their residences, workplaces or any of their children. No unsupervised contact w/any minor females.  DE must reside with his mother in Sun Prairie.  DE must take all prescribed medications as prescribed.  DE may not leave the State of WI.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 3:11 PM Defendant John M. Garrett Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for John M. Garrett Jr.  Attorney Emily Eklund in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dolch advises counsel met in chambers prior to court and agree to a reduction to $1,000 cash bond.  State agrees with the reduction but address concerns with conditions.  Counsel does not have any additional conditions or objections to the conditions that the Court imposed.  Court modifies bond to a $1,000.00 CASH bond.  Special bond conditions: No contact with the victim, her mother and DE's aunt or their residences, workplaces or any of their children.  No unsupervised contact with any minor females.  DE must reside with his mother in Sun Prairie.  DE must take all prescribed medications as prescribed.  DE may not leave the State of Wisconsin.
Motion hearing on October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:09 PM Defendant John M. Garrett Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Janae F. Hochmuth appeared by video for John M. Garrett Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $10,000 cash bond.  Atty Hochmuth recommends a $1,000 cash bond.  $10,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with A.L.S. or S.A.M., their residences, workplaces or any of their children.  No contact with anyone under the age of 18.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
